intro: Blakea coloradensis, commonly known as the Colorado Blakea, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colorado. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to cold, dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
